predictions.text: Eurostat will report euro area (EA20) Core HICP flash inflation (YoY) for November 2025 between 2.7% and 3.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Eurostat's HICP flash release for November 2025 shows Core HICP (ex energy and unprocessed food) YoY in [2.7%, 3.2%].
evidence: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/macroeconomic-statistics/inflation-prices
Recent EA core inflation running near ~3% with easing goods disinflation but sticky services.
Oil stabilization and base effects keep headline contained; core trends smoother.
monitoring_signals: ECB nowcasts and services inflation proxies
predictions.rationale: Core inflation trend easing but still near 3%, with national prints likely to cluster around that range.

predictions.text: U.S. Core PCE Price Index (YoY, SA) for October 2025 will print between 2.6% and 2.9% in the BEA release.
predictions.verification_criteria: BEA's PCE release shows Core PCE Price Index 12-month percent change within [2.6%, 2.9%].
evidence: https://www.bea.gov/data/personal-consumption-expenditures-price-index
Recent CPI/PPI imply ~0.2% core MoM PCE and ongoing YoY glide toward high-2s.
Core goods deflation offsets sticky services; healthcare weights favor PCE vs CPI.
predictions.rationale: October CPI/PPI mix is consistent with a core PCE YoY print in the high-2% range.

predictions.text: China Caixin Manufacturing PMI (headline) for November 2025 will print between 50.0 and 51.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Caixin official PMI report for November 2025 shows headline index in [50.0, 51.0].
evidence: https://www.caixinglobal.com/data/pmi
Caixin tends to outperform NBS when private SMEs stabilize; recent readings hovered near 50.
External demand showing tentative improvement; domestic stimulus modest.
monitoring_signals: Export orders subindices and new orders in Caixin flash commentary
CNY exchange rate and credit impulse proxies
predictions.rationale: Private-sector activity likely modestly expansionary, aligning with recent stabilization signals.

predictions.text: Microsoft’s December 2025 Patch Tuesday will include at least one CVE marked as "Exploited: Yes" in the wild.
predictions.verification_criteria: On the December 2025 release date, Microsoft Security Update Guide lists at least one CVE with Exploited flag set to Yes.
evidence: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide
Historical cadence: frequent zero-day disclosures with exploitation noted in monthly bulletins.
Late-year campaigns often drive end-of-year KEV and zero-day adds.
monitoring_signals: Threat intel reports (Google TAG, Mandiant, CISA alerts)
Early partner pre-briefings and patch previews
predictions.rationale: Recent years show a steady cadence of exploited zero-days revealed around Patch Tuesday.

predictions.text: CISA will add at least 10 CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog with Date Added between 2025-12-01 and 2025-12-15 inclusive.
predictions.verification_criteria: Count entries on CISA KEV catalog where Date Added is 2025-12-01 through 2025-12-15 inclusive; total >= 10.
evidence: https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog
Year-end advisories and Patch Tuesday often trigger KEV additions.
Active exploitation campaigns tend to surge before holidays.
monitoring_signals: CISA ICS alerts and emergency directives
Exploit kit activity and telemetry from major security vendors
predictions.rationale: December typically sees elevated KEV entries following major vendor patch cycles.

predictions.text: Cboe VVIX Index will close at or above 105.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-12-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Cboe-published official daily VVIX close >= 105.0 by the deadline.
evidence: https://www.cboe.com/tradable_products/vix/vvix/
Seasonal volatility episodes into mid-December; macro/geopolitical event risk elevated.
Skew and term structure shifts often precede VVIX spikes.
monitoring_signals: SPX put-call skew and dealer gamma positioning
predictions.rationale: Even modest shocks can lift VVIX above 105 given thin year-end liquidity.

predictions.text: NYMEX Henry Hub front-month natural gas will settle at or above $3.60 per MMBtu on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: CME/NYMEX official front-month Henry Hub futures settlement price >= $3.60/MMBtu by deadline.
evidence: https://www.cmegroup.com/markets/energy/natural-gas/natural-gas.html
Winter HDDs and first large storage draws can trigger price spikes.
TTF volatility and LNG flows can tighten U.S. balances.
monitoring_signals: Ensemble weather forecasts (HDDs) and NatGasWeather updates
LNG feedgas flows and export terminal availability
predictions.rationale: Seasonal demand and potential cold shots raise odds of at least one tactical spike.

predictions.text: Daily sunspot number will reach at least 200 on at least one UTC day by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: NOAA/SWPC reported daily sunspot number (official daily value) >= 200 on any day by deadline.
evidence: https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/products/solar-cycle-progression
Solar Cycle 25 is near/maximizing; elevated activity increases high SSN days.
Recent G2–G3 storm watches indicate active regions.
monitoring_signals: 10.7 cm solar radio flux index levels
predictions.rationale: Solar max conditions make 200+ daily sunspot counts plausible before year-end.

predictions.text: Adobe Analytics will report U.S. Cyber Monday 2025 online spending of at least $13.0 billion.
predictions.verification_criteria: Adobe Digital Economy Index post-event report cites Cyber Monday 2025 U.S. online spend >= $13.0B.
evidence: https://business.adobe.com/resources/digital-economy-index.html
Thanksgiving/Black Friday trends show steady YoY growth and record promotional intensity.
Higher mobile conversion and BNPL usage support larger basket sizes.
monitoring_signals: Adobe real-time spend trackers on Cyber Monday
predictions.rationale: Secular e-commerce growth plus heavy discounting should push a fresh Cyber Monday record.

predictions.text: By 2025-12-31, OFAC will sanction at least one China-based entity for Russia-related evasion or support, via an official U.S. Treasury press release.
predictions.verification_criteria: U.S. Treasury press release lists a China-based entity designated under Russia-related authorities (e.g., EO 14024) by the deadline.
evidence: https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-releases
U.S. pattern of targeting PRC firms aiding Russia’s defense-industrial base.
G7 coordination on sanctions enforcement intensifying into year-end.
monitoring_signals: State/Treasury briefings referencing PRC assistance to Russia
G7/EU sanctions packages mentioning third-country facilitators
Commerce Entity List actions aligned with OFAC designations
predictions.rationale: U.S. pressure on PRC intermediaries has escalated; another designation by year-end is likely.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year breakeven inflation rate (FRED: T10YIE) will close at or above 2.50% on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED series T10YIE daily close >= 2.50% at least once by deadline.
evidence: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/T10YIE
Oil price rebounds and firm services inflation can lift breakevens.
Risk-on tone and term-premium dynamics can nudge inflation compensation higher.
monitoring_signals: Inflation swap (ZCIS) levels vs TIPS auction results
predictions.rationale: A modest reflation impulse could lift breakevens to 2.5% briefly before year-end.
